definitions.text: arouse hostility or indifference in where there had formerly been love, affection, or friendliness
examples: She alienated her friends when she became fanatically religious
The will aliened the property to the heirs

definitions.text: make withdrawn or isolated or emotionally dissociated
examples: the boring work alienated his employees
anomic loners musing over their fate
we live in an age of rootless alienated people
